snippet.title: International Moto X - PlayStation Gameplay
snippet.description:
Developed by Graftgold, International Moto X is an early motocross game for the PS1, coming out in 1996. In fact, it might be the first ever motocross game on the PlayStation... at least in English, since it 
only came out in Europe and Japan. But even with the lack of a US version, it is a pretty dang good one. It has its own unique 3D engine, which offers realistic bike handling, breakneck speeds and (for the time) unrivalled
graphics. The game contains 30 tracks across 4 continents, as well as three game modes: Practice, Time-Trial and Tournament. You can also earn cash to upgrade your bike to improve chances to finish 1st at a tournament.

But perhaps the biggest highlight is not only you can create your own tracks, but also your own tournament for official courses, custom tracks or a combination of both! You can save up to 16 custom tracks onto a single memory card.
Seriously, for what might be the first MX game on PS1 and not even released in the USA, this is quite an accomplishment.
